Thanks for offering your help.

Firstly, a man page - these things have a main() so should have a decent man
page - not just a few mentions here and there in various differnt documents.
IN particular the man page should explain in sufficient detail about the
auto-loading and any other funky stuff.

Secondly, because at least one of these runners (the TextRunner) tends to
get run within ones own code, I would suggest that the public methods shold
be javadoc'd, including a precise description of any reflective magice that
is going on.

As an example of an issue I had I was trying to write a test suite that I
could run with a *Runner - I was under the impression that just having a
class MyTestSuite with a static method  TestSuite suite() and executing java
*Runner MyTestSuite would run the tests - but to no avail. Of course I can
put a main() in MyTestSuite with code similar to *Runner.run(new
MyTestSuite()) and that will work! I started looking through the source code
of the TextRunner to try to work it out but decided it wasn't important
enough to me at the time. So that's an exaple of where documentation would
have helped.

Toby
